stem: The clinic nurse is reviewing the electronic health records (EHR) of four adult clients scheduled for wellness visits today. Based on the documented history, age, and risk factors in the EHR, match each client with the most appropriate priority screening test.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
08:15: Ms. Anya Sharma (48y/o) presents for a physical. She remains asymptomatic but expresses significant concern regarding family history. Her mother was diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma at age 52. 

08:45: Mr. Ben Carter (64y/o) presents for evaluation of a persistent cough. Social history reveals a 2-pack-per-day smoking habit since age 24. He has tried unsuccessfully to quit four times. 

09:30: Mr. Carl Davis (74y/o) is here for follow-up of HTN. Review of record shows last colonoscopy was 11 years ago; result was 'normal'. Family Hx: Father had colon cancer in his 60s. 

10:15: Ms. Daisy Evans (20y/o) is here for contraceptive counseling. She reports being sexually active with two new partners over the last 6 months and indicates inconsistent barrier protection use.

tabs.title: Historical Labs
tabs.content:
A. Sharma (Last year): CBC normal, Lipid panel WNL.
B. Carter: BMI 31. Total Cholesterol 220 mg/dL.
C. Davis: Creatinine 1.2 mg/dL. K+ 4.0. LDL 142 mg/dL.
D. Evans: Pelvic exam WNL. UCG (Pregnancy test) Negative.

tabs.title: Physical Exam
tabs.content:
A. Sharma: Breast exam negative for masses, nipple discharge, or skin changes. Axillary nodes non-palpable. 
B. Carter: Barrel chest appearance noted. Diminished breath sounds in upper lobes. 
C. Davis: Abdomen soft, non-tender. Rectal exam: Heme-negative stool. 
D. Evans: No vaginal discharge or lesions.

rows.text: Ms. Anya Sharma (48 years old, strong family history of breast cancer)
Mr. Ben Carter (64 years old, 80 pack-year smoking history)
Mr. Carl Davis (74 years old, last colonoscopy > 10 years ago)
Ms. Daisy Evans (20 years old, high-risk sexual behavior)

columns.text: Low-dose CT Scan of the Chest (LDCT)

rationale.correct: Anya Sharma (48) requires a mammogram; ACS recommends annual screening for women 45-54. Ben Carter meets criteria for LDCT (age 50-80 with >20 pack-year history). Carl Davis is due for a colonoscopy as it has been >10 years since his last one, and he has a family history. Daisy Evans requires STI screening per CDC guidelines for sexually active women < 25.
rationale.incorrect: Incorrect pairings ignore the specific risk factors (smoking history, time since last screening, age-specific STI risks) presented in the EHR.

answerBreakdown.rationale: Recommended annually for women in her age bracket.
Meets USPSTF criteria for lung cancer screening with LDCT.
The standard interval for colonoscopy is 10 years; he is now overdue at 11 years.
Annual STI screening is recommended for all sexually active women under 25.

clinicalPearls: Lung cancer screening (LDCT) is specifically for smokers/former smokers with a significant pack-year history.
Colonoscopy intervals may be shortened if polyps were previously found or if family history is strong.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking a 74-year-old is too old for a colonoscopy or that a 20-year-old only needs a PAP smear.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember that USPSTF colonoscopy screening continues to age 75 and STI screening is based on age/behavior regardless of symptoms.
